snippet: Experts worry that Thailand, the world’s leading rice exporter, may have trouble finding people to work in rice paddies, as young people stay longer in school and prefer to work in Bangkok.
abstract: Young Thai people are staying longer in schools and prefer to work in Bangkok, as opposed to working as rice farmers; experts worry that the country, the world's leading exporter of rice, may have trouble finding people to work in its 32 million acres of paddies.
lead_paragraph: Experts worry that Thailand, the world’s leading rice exporter, may have trouble finding people to work in rice paddies, as young people stay longer in school and prefer to work in Bangkok.

headline.seo: Thai Youth Seek a Fortune Away From the Farm
headline.main: Thai Youth Seek a Fortune Away From the Farm
headline.print_headline: Young Thais Flee Their Rice Heartland
